story.text: TORONTO Jan 3 The Toronto Stock Exchange's main index shed more than 200 points on Wednesday, as investors bailed out of sinking resources and energy shares that dragged down the broader market. The S&P/TSX composite index .GSPTSE fell 201.47 points, or 1.6 percent, to 12,722.19 shortly after 2 p.m., extending a plunge that first hit the benchmark shortly after trading began.
story.title: toronto stock index sinks 200 pts on resources
